relation: Name of path to the file
One or more properties and their values to be set, returned, or both, depending on prop_flags (see DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_PROPERTIES_T Table Type)
BLOB holding data with which to populate the file (optional)

Determines which properties are set, returned, or both. Default is PROP_STD. Specify properties to be returned by setting prop_spec, and providing an instance of the DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_PROPERTIES_T Table Type with properties whose values are of interest.
File system user for whom the access check is made
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {34538=32768, 9463=The following constants are useful for declaring paths and item names. Paths are limited to 1024 characters and item names are limited to 256 characters., 37015=131072, 11782=1024, 37636=262144, 32154=2048}
textBeforeTable: Table 47-22 CREATEFILE Procedure Parameters Parameters principal IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL); store_name IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, prop_flags IN INTEGER DEFAULT (PROP_STD + PROP_DATA), content IN OUT NOCOPY BLOB, properties IN OUT NOCOPY PROPERTIES_T, path IN VARCHAR2, DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.CREATEFILE ( principal IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL); store_name IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, prop_flags IN INTEGER DEFAULT (PROP_STD + PROP_DATA), content IN OUT NOCOPY BLOB, properties IN OUT NOCOPY DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_PROPERTIES_T, path IN VARCHAR2, DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.CREATEFILE ( Syntax  This procedure creates a file. CREATEFILE Procedures     File system user for whom the access check is made principal Name of store store_name If 0, do not execute recursively; otherwise, recursively create the directories above the given directory recurse Determines which properties are set, returned, or both. Default is PROP_STD. Specify properties to be returned by setting PROP_SPC (see DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT Constants - Property Access Flags), and providing an instance of the DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_PROPERTIES_T Table Type with properties whose values are of interest. prop_flags
textAfterTable: CREATELINK Procedures This procedure creates a new reference to the source file system element (such as a file, or directory). The resulting reference points to the source element but does not directly share metadata with the source element. This is analogous to a UNIX file system symbolic link. Syntax DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.CREATELINK ( srcPath IN VARCHAR2, dstPath IN VARCHAR2, properties IN OUT NOCOPY DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_PROPERTIES_T, prop_flags IN INTEGER DEFAULT PROP_STD, store_name IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, principal IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL); DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.CREATELINK ( srcPath IN VARCHAR2, dstPath IN VARCHAR2, properties IN OUT NOCOPY PROPERTIES_T, prop_flags IN INTEGER DEFAULT PROP_STD, store_name IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, principal IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL); Parameters Table 47-23 CREATELINK Procedure Parameters Parameter Description srcPath File system entry with which to link dstPath Path of the new link element to be created properties
